name: Nengo
description: Library for creating and simulating large-scale brain models.

name: Nitime
description: Timeseries analysis for neuroscience data.

name: Nilearn
description: Module for performing statistical learning/machine learning on NeuroImaging data.

name: DIPY
description: Toolbox for analysis of MR diffusion imaging.

name: MNE-Python
description: Community-driven software for processing time-resolved neural signals including electroencephalography (EEG) and magnetoencephalography (MEG).

name: NiBabel
description: Provides read and write access to some common medical and neuroimaging file formats.

name: PsychoPy
description: Package for running psychology and neuroscience experiments. It allows for creating psychology stimuli in Python.

name: NuPic
description: Numenta Platform for Intelligent Computing is an implementation of Hierarchical Temporal Memory (HTM), a theory of intelligence based strictly on the neuroscience of the neocortex.

name: Brian2
description: Free, open source simulator for spiking neural networks.

name: expyriment
description: Platform-independent lightweight Python library for designing and conducting timing-critical behavioural and neuroimaging experiments.

name: BindsNET
description: Package for simulating spiking neural networks for reinforcement & machine learning.

name: SpikeInterface
description: Framework designed to unify spike-sorting technologies

name: Brain Dynamics Toolbox
description: Open software for simulating dynamical systems in neuroscience.

name: BrainStorm
description: Open-source application dedicated to the analysis of brain recordings (MEG, EEG, fNIRS, ECoG, depth electrodes and multiunit electrophysiology).

name: EEGLAB
description: Interactive Matlab toolbox for processing continuous and event-related EEG, MEG and other electrophysiological data.

name: FieldTrip
description: Toolbox for MEG and EEG analysis.

name: Psychtoolbox-3
description: Free set of Matlab and GNU Octave functions for vision and neuroscience research.

name: SPM
description: Free and open source software for the  analysis of brain imaging data sequences (fMRI, PET, SPECT, EEG, MEG).

name: Brayns
description: Minimalistic visualiser that can perform ray-traced rendering of neurons. Ray-tracing can help to highlight areas of neural circuits where cells touch each other and where synapses are being created leading to a better understanding of how individual cells and subsequently the brain functions.

name: Brainbrowser
description: Library exposing set of web-based 3D visualization tools primarily targetting neuroimaging.

name: jsPsych
description: Library for creating and running behavioural experiments in a web browser.

name: nat: NeuroAnatomy Toolbox
description: Package for the (3D) visualisation and analysis of biological image data, especially tracings of single neurons.

name: brainGraph
description: Package for performing graph theory analyses of brain MRI data.

name: Neuroscience Online
description: Open-access electronic textbook and interactive courseware covering neuroscience in depth. Provided by the Department of Neurobiology and Anantomy at the University of Texas Medical School at Houston.

name: Computational Cognitive Neuroscience
description: Text which provides an in-depth introduction to the main ideas in the computational cognitive neuroscience, a field which aims to understand the brain by using biologically based computational models.

name: Neuronal Dynamics
description: Open-access electronic textbook that covers computational and theoretical neuroscience. Provided by École Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne (EPFL).

name: Neuroskeptic
description: Discover magazine's neuroscience blog which offers a look at the latest developments in neuroscience, psychiatry and psychology through a critical lens.

name: The Neurocritic
description: Often critical takes on the most sensationalistic recent findings in Human Brain Imaging, Cognitive Neuroscience, and Psychopharmacology.

name: The scicurious brain
description: Maintained by Scientific American, this blog typically covers one research paper in a single entry.

name: Action Potential
description: Forum operated by neuroscience editors at the journal, Nature.

name: The Fundamentals of Neuroscience | Harvard & edX
description: Serves an introductory survery of topics in neuroscience and has no specific prerequisites, though some prior exposure to biology and/or chemistry can be helpful.

name: Introduction to Neuroscience | MIT OCW
description: Introduction to the mammalian nervous system, with emphasis on the structure and function of the human brain.

name: Computational Neuroscience | Coursera
description: Provides an introduction to basic computational methods for understanding what nervous systems do and for determining how they function.

name: Medical Neuroscience
description: Explores the functional organization and neurophysiology of the human central nervous system, while providing a neurobiological framework for understanding human behavior.

name: Neuromatch Academy
description: Jupyter notebooks for the three-week intensive summer school in computational neuroscience.

name: Quora
description: Neuroscience topic on Quora contains answers, often by experts, to questions ranging from basic to advanced.

name: Reddit
description: List of neuroscience, psychology and cognitive science subreddits.

name: StackExchange
description: Psychology and neuroscience StackExchange site.

name: On The Brain
description: Harvard Mahoney Neuroscience Institute's quarterly e-newsletter.

name: Comp-neuro
description: A mailing list that is is intended to address the broad range of research approaches and issues involved in the general field of computational neuroscience.

name: BrainPost
description: A mailing list that delivers weekly easy-to-read summaries of the latest neuroscience publications.

name: Awesome Public Datasets
description: Neuroscience - High-quality open neuroscience datasets.

name: McCulloch & Pitts Neural Net Simulator
description: Simulator for a historical computational model based on neurons.

name: ModelDB
description: Searchable database for computational neuroscience models.

name: NeuronDB
description: Searchable database for  of three types of neuronal properties: voltage gated conductances, neurotransmitter receptors, and neurotransmitter substances.

name: NeuroElectro
description: Searchable database of neurons and their electrophysiological properties (extracted from literature)

name: Neuroscience Mindmap
description: Interactive mindmap containing curated resources for anyone interested in learning neuroscience.

name: neuroSummerSchools
description: List of summer (and seasonal) summer schools in neuroscience and related fields.

name: Brain Matters
description: Neuroscience podcast where real neuroscientists sit down and talk about the brain.
